attributes.action: Implement restrictions on former PMs’ Public Duties Cost Allowance (PDCA)
attributes.additional_details: It would be grossly inappropriate for a former PM who has caused such detriment to the National economy to be eligible to such an award. Particularly in the face of renewed austerity.
attributes.background: Parliament should consider restricting qualifying criteria to PDCA (currently up to £115k pa) to disqualify any former PM who has not served a minimum term in post.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see restrictions to eligibility to access the Public Duty Costs Allowance, but it's not clear what length term you want a Prime Minister to have served before becoming eligible to access this allowance.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
